intro: Acmella papposa, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in full sun with well-drained soil. Acmella papposa is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
